meanings.definition: Of or relating to the process of making an official decision or judgment.
meanings.sent1: The adjudicative role of the judge is crucial in court.
meanings.sent2: The adjudicative process ensures fairness in legal matters.
meanings.sent3: The adjudicative owl carefully deliberated on the forest dispute.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had an adjudicative gaze, seeing through the lies.
meanings.sent5: The scales of justice symbolize the adjudicative nature of the law.

meanings.definition: Involving or having the authority to settle disputes or issues through a formal legal process.
meanings.sent1: The adjudicative power of the court brings resolution to conflicts.
meanings.sent2: An adjudicative body like a tribunal can make binding decisions.
meanings.sent3: The adjudicative penguin presided over the fish-sharing quarrel.
meanings.sent4: His words had an adjudicative effect, calming the heated argument.
meanings.sent5: The gavel's sound marked the start of the adjudicative session.
